data.title: add kerning flag in FreeTypeFontParameter
data.body: in FreeTypeFontParameter add a kerning flag, and in FreeTypeFontGenerator.generateData(), use this flag to determine if kerning should be generated.

data.title: i18n - can't set manual locale
data.body:
I tried the example from the wiki:

```
 FileHandle baseFileHandle = Gdx.files.internal("language");
 Locale locale = new Locale("en");
 mLanguage = I18NBundle.createBundle(baseFileHandle, locale);
```

My bundle files are

```
language.properties (de)
language_en.properties (en)
```

or the second test

```
language.properties (en)
language_de.properties (de)
```

Everytime, I got data from the _de_ bundle, because my desktop system is german.

How can I set the locale other than my host system?

data.title: Skin does not regard type hierarchy
data.body:
Consider this piece of code:

```
skin.add("name", atlas.findRegion("someRegion"));
```

An `AtlasRegion` is added to the skin.

Now you would expect `getDrawable("name")` to return a, referring to the documentation, appropriate `Drawable` (`NinePatchDrawable`, `SpriteDrawable` or simply `TextureRegionDrawable`). Instead, an exception is thrown saying no Drawable, NinePatch, TextureRegion, Texture or Sprite with the name "name" was found.

Looking at the code, the author apparently expected `getRegion(String)` to return a `TextureRegion` or subclass of it in `getDrawable(String)`:

```
TextureRegion textureRegion = getRegion(name);
if (textureRegion instanceof AtlasRegion) { ... }
```

`getRegion` only returns a `TextureRegion` though because it uses `optional(String, Class<?>)` which uses the given Class parameter to get the object from `resources` which is an `ObjectMap` that uses Classes as keys.

Either `getRegion(String)` should traverse the `resources` map to check for subclasses (sounds slow to me) or `getDrawable(String)` should expect this behavior and explicitly search for an `AtlasRegion`. Currently, the if statement `textureRegion instanceof AtlasRegion` in line [270](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/scenes/scene2d/ui/Skin.java#L270) is never true. Note this also happens in [`getSprite(String)`](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/scenes/scene2d/ui/Skin.java#L245) and [`getPatch(String)`](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/scenes/scene2d/ui/Skin.java#L220).

data.title: Tiled map performance issues.
data.body:
Hi ! We just released our libgdx game on android platform. Currently, we are focusing on publishing our game built with the latest version of libgdx and robovm to apple store. But we are trapped with one big problem which impeded our release : 

Our game is level-based using tiled and the tmx format. When we run our game in a level with larger tiled map, there are alway some non/constant lag. To the levels with smaller tiled map, it is ok. The lag seems to be with regular interval (around 2-3 seconds) and it lasts only for around 300ms. Is this libgdx related or Robovm related?

We run Libgdx version 1.1.0 and robovm 0.0.14, the game runs well on Android and Desktop.

data.title: Music interface getPosition() gives seconds or milliseconds based on backend.
data.body: The documentation in com.badlogic.gdx.audio.Music for getPosition() reads /*\* Returns the playback position in milliseconds. */ The desktop backend call with AL11.AL_SEC_OFFSET natively returns a value in seconds. The android and gwt backends return values that are divided by 1000, giving seconds. The iOS backend returns a value multiplied by 1000, giving milliseconds (I assume). Perhaps change the documentation and the iOS backend or change the desktop, android, and gwt backends. (On another note, issue #921 still is around, this issue especially breaks games that need to sync time to the music, like Stepmania. Calls to Music.getPosition() on the desktop backend return values that increase too quickly (maybe this depends on the hardware implementation?). You can test this by playing music and keeping elapsed time in the application's render method with Gdx.graphics.getDeltaTIme(). If you compare the elapsed time to what getPosition() returns you will see that getPosition() increases at a faster rate that the elapsed time. You can modify the MusicTest file in gdx-tests to set this up quickly but note that this does not happen with all songs, here is one that it does happen with (for me at least): https://drive.google.com/file/d/0Bx9k9I8v-JzvV19Gd0xBUk02TWs/edit?usp=sharing. I have no clue about openal but doing a quick google search many people say that AL11.AL_SEC_OFFSET rounds and that perhaps AL_SAMPLE_OFFSET divided by the sample rate will be a more accurate value? I also notice that the desktop backend keeps track of renderedSeconds which gets added to AL_SEC_OFFSET??)

Make findActor method in Group return typed actor
data.body: Since there are no names by default, if `findActor` returns something, it has known type to the user, because he is the one who assigns names. This tiny pull request reduces typecasting boilerplate.

data.title: Actor's clipBegin() clips the entire screen.
Extension: libGDX Pay API.
data.body:
Given there has been no progress, I have converted my old draft for the libGDX payment API to a libGDX extension. The extension isn't linked into the libGDX build system so far. Also, this should probably be a branch? In any case, this is a draft for the pay API extension, so I am looking for feedback. 

FOR USERS:
To see how it works for a user of the payment API, have a look at "PurchaseManager.java" (Javadoc part explaining it all how to create a new payment service and make purchases).

FOR CONTRIBUTORS/LIBGDX DEVELOPERS:
libGDX contributors (e.g. contributing the IAP for Google Play, iTunes, Amazon etc.) will need to implement the PurchaseManager.java and fill in the 2 functions in there. Have a look at my "PurchaseManagerGoogleAndroid.java" on what would be needed. It's still empty.

Anyhow, the purchase API is pretty bare-bone. I think in the long-run we should add an Inventory.java on top of the libGDX Pay API which keeps track of purchases. I am flexible what naming concerns. It's possible that I got some things wrong. I believe there might be some people with a lot more experience so I'd be glad to address any concerns you guys have. Please note that I tried to simplify several things from my previous pull request (from last year). :-D

data.title: LibGDX minimum API is 9 instead of 8
data.body:
http://www.badlogicgames.com/wordpress/?p=3297 says that the minimum Android API is 8.

However https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/commit/cff4b2ae3ba995fba4b36118ba72352326411697 added https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/utils/SharedLibraryLoader.java#L192 to the code. http://developer.android.com/reference/java/io/File.html#canExecute%28%29 says that it's only available from API level 9 upwards.

Thus running it on an API 8 device/emulator results in this:

```
06-07 19:38:28.780: I/dalvikvm(302): Could not find method java.io.File.canExecute, referenced from method com.badlogic.gdx.utils.SharedLibraryLoader.canWrite
06-07 19:38:28.780: W/dalvikvm(302): VFY: unable to resolve virtual method 16075: Ljava/io/File;.canExecute ()Z
06-07 19:38:28.801: D/dalvikvm(302): VFY: replacing opcode 0x6e at 0x0011
06-07 19:38:28.801: I/dalvikvm(302): Could not find method java.io.File.canExecute, referenced from method com.badlogic.gdx.utils.SharedLibraryLoader.canWrite
06-07 19:38:28.801: W/dalvikvm(302): VFY: unable to resolve virtual method 16075: Ljava/io/File;.canExecute ()Z
06-07 19:38:28.801: D/dalvikvm(302): VFY: replacing opcode 0x6e at 0x002d
06-07 19:38:28.810: D/dalvikvm(302): VFY: dead code 0x0014-0016 in Lcom/badlogic/gdx/utils/SharedLibraryLoader;.canWrite (Ljava/io/File;)Z
06-07 19:38:28.810: D/dalvikvm(302): VFY: dead code 0x0018-0024 in Lcom/badlogic/gdx/utils/SharedLibraryLoader;.canWrite (Ljava/io/File;)Z
06-07 19:38:28.810: D/dalvikvm(302): VFY: dead code 0x0030-0036 in Lcom/badlogic/gdx/utils/SharedLibraryLoader;.canWrite (Ljava/io/File;)Z
06-07 19:38:28.810: D/dalvikvm(302): VFY: dead code 0x0042-0046 in Lcom/badlogic/gdx/utils/SharedLibraryLoader;.canWrite (Ljava/io/File;)Z
06-07 19:38:28.910: D/dalvikvm(302): Trying to load lib /data/data/com.devaug.test.android/lib/libgdx.so 0x526aecf8
06-07 19:38:28.910: D/dalvikvm(302): Added shared lib /data/data/com.devaug.test.android/lib/libgdx.so 0x526aecf8
06-07 19:38:28.910: D/dalvikvm(302): No JNI_OnLoad found in /data/data/com.devaug.test.android/lib/libgdx.so 0x526aecf8, skipping init
06-07 19:38:28.980: D/libEGL(302): egl.cfg not found, using default config
06-07 19:38:28.980: D/libEGL(302): loaded /system/lib/egl/libGLES_android.so
06-07 19:38:29.020: D/AndroidRuntime(302): Shutting down VM
06-07 19:38:29.020: W/dalvikvm(302): threadid=1: thread exiting with uncaught exception (group=0x4001d800)
06-07 19:38:29.051: E/AndroidRuntime(302): FATAL EXCEPTION: main
06-07 19:38:29.051: E/AndroidRuntime(302): java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to start activity ComponentInfo{com.devaug.test.android/com.devaug.test.android.AndroidLauncher}: com.badlogic.gdx.utils.GdxRuntimeException: Libgdx requires OpenGL ES 2.0
06-07 19:38:29.051: E/AndroidRuntime(302):      at android.app.ActivityThread.performLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2663)
06-07 19:38:29.051: E/AndroidRuntime(302):      at android.app.ActivityThread.handleLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2679)
06-07 19:38:29.051: E/AndroidRuntime(302):      at android.app.ActivityThread.access$2300(ActivityThread.java:125)
06-07 19:38:29.051: E/AndroidRuntime(302):      at android.app.ActivityThread$H.handleMessage(ActivityThread.java:2033)
06-07 19:38:29.051: E/AndroidRuntime(302):      at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:99)
06-07 19:38:29.051: E/AndroidRuntime(302):      at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:123)
06-07 19:38:29.051: E/AndroidRuntime(302):      at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:4627)
06-07 19:38:29.051: E/AndroidRuntime(302):      at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method)
06-07 19:38:29.051: E/AndroidRuntime(302):      at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:521)
06-07 19:38:29.051: E/AndroidRuntime(302):      at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:868)
06-07 19:38:29.051: E/AndroidRuntime(302):      at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:626)
06-07 19:38:29.051: E/AndroidRuntime(302):      at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method)
06-07 19:38:29.051: E/AndroidRuntime(302): Caused by: com.badlogic.gdx.utils.GdxRuntimeException: Libgdx requires OpenGL ES 2.0
06-07 19:38:29.051: E/AndroidRuntime(302):      at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.android.AndroidGraphics.createGLSurfaceView(AndroidGraphics.java:121)
06-07 19:38:29.051: E/AndroidRuntime(302):      at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.android.AndroidGraphics.<init>(AndroidGraphics.java:101)
06-07 19:38:29.051: E/AndroidRuntime(302):      at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.android.AndroidGraphics.<init>(AndroidGraphics.java:94)
06-07 19:38:29.051: E/AndroidRuntime(302):      at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.android.AndroidApplication.init(AndroidApplication.java:130)
06-07 19:38:29.051: E/AndroidRuntime(302):      at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.android.AndroidApplication.initialize(AndroidApplication.java:96)
06-07 19:38:29.051: E/AndroidRuntime(302):      at com.devaug.test.android.AndroidLauncher.onCreate(AndroidLauncher.java:14)
06-07 19:38:29.051: E/AndroidRuntime(302):      at android.app.Instrumentation.callActivityOnCreate(Instrumentation.java:1047)
06-07 19:38:29.051: E/AndroidRuntime(302):      at android.app.ActivityThread.performLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2627)
06-07 19:38:29.051: E/AndroidRuntime(302):      ... 11 more
```

I'm not sure how this should be resolved. This "bug" was encountered by someone in the IRC channel and he said that he even had problems with API level 10, but I didn't look into that unfortunately. Since the change introducing this API 9 method was fixing something, we might not want to undo that. However in this case we should at least say that API level 8 is not supported.

data.title: TiledMapRenderer culling bug

Hello !
The culling method for the tiledmaprenderer works good, only if the rotation of the camera is 0.

If the camera is rotating, there will be tiles on the screen that are not rendered!

data.title: Avoid unnecessary memory allocation on ImmediateModeRenderer20 end() call
data.body:
Removes the implicit StringBuilder to generate the uniform name instantiated on every end() call replacing it with pre-generated values.

Because the end() method can be called once or more per frame, this could lead to memory allocation issues.

data.title: Avoid unnecessary memory allocation on ImmediateModeRenderer20 end() call
data.body:
Removes the implicit StringBuilder to generate the uniform name instantiated on every end() call replacing it with pre-generated values.

Because the end() method can be called once or more per frame, this could lead to memory allocation issues.

data.title: Use of sensorLandscape loses context when lock button is pressed
data.body:
android:screenOrientation="landscape"
            android:configChanges="keyboard|keyboardHidden|orientation|screenLayout|uiMode|screenSize|smallestScreenSize">

Landscape mode works. Obviously reverseLandscape doesn't work.

What happens when home button is pressed or a call is received?
- Pause is called and context is retained. No issues.

What happens when the device lock button is pressed?
- Pause is called and context is retained. No issues.

If a developer wants to support both landscape modes supporting min sdk of 9, they can do-

android:screenOrientation="sensorLandscape"
            android:configChanges="keyboard|keyboardHidden|screenLayout|uiMode|screenSize|smallestScreenSize">

Both Landscape and reverseLandscape modes work. User can rotate their device on either landscape mode with no issues.

What happens when home button is pressed or a call is received?
- Pause is called and context is retained. No issues.

What happens when the device lock button is pressed?
- Context is NOT retained. Android recreates the activity. Hence, starts from the beginning.

libGDX Version: 1.1.0
Tested on: 
Samsung Galaxy Nexus 4.2.1
Nexus 5 4.4.2

data.title: libGDX game crashes on ART, Google's successor for dalvik.
data.body:
Reason is the allocation of a ByteBuffer of size "0" in "IndexBufferObject". This breaks all libGDX Meshes which don't make use of indexes and set the "maxIndexes" to 0 (which in turn breaks quite a lot of libGDX apps on ART I assume.)

While allocating a 0-sized ByteBuffer is perfectly fine according to the javadoc, ART has a bug that makes programs crash if they try to do so. Only sizes >0 do work.

This is a bug in ART admitted and even fixed by Google with https://android-review.googlesource.com/#/c/73175/ .

Unfortunately, that fix is (although committed half a year ago...) not even part of current Android (4.4.3 as of this writing), and it's still unknown (to me) in which release it will finally be available.

So I kindly ask you to accept this pull request to work around that problem for the time being.

Thank you!

data.title: Can't draw large image.
Allow customizing view of elements in SelectBox/List
data.body:
Current implementation forces vizualization of elements to look like labels with `toString()`'s of that elements (for performance reasons, i believe). That's too restrictive, it would be better to provide ability to use custom views (like it is implemented in tree's node actors).
Something like `setElementVisualizer(IElementVisualizer<T> visualizer)` with api `Actor createActor(T element)` would do the trick. It can also default to LabelVisualizer, which just creates labels using `toString()`, so behaviour and existing api will survive.

data.title: SpotLight per fragment lightning
data.body:
Ok let's explain in a few words : here is my implementation for the gdx lights : I added the spotlight, and make a per fragment rendering shader BUT this is not working completely and I don't know what is the issue so any help would be very appreciated.
The Libgdx tests are useful to reveal what's wrong : see LightTest, and SpotLightTest.

Also notice there are warnings in the shader : 

```
Shader compilation : 
Shader compilation : 
Shader compilation : Vertex info
-----------
0(166) : warning C7514: OpenGL does not allow varying of type struct DirectionalLight[2]
0(183) : warning C7514: OpenGL does not allow varying of type struct PointLightInterpolated[5]
0(208) : warning C7514: OpenGL does not allow varying of type struct SpotLightInterpolated[2]

Fragment info
-------------
0(82) : warning C7514: OpenGL does not allow varying of type struct DirectionalLight[2]
0(99) : warning C7514: OpenGL does not allow varying of type struct PointLightInterpolated[5]
0(125) : warning C7514: OpenGL does not allow varying of type struct SpotLightInterpolated[2]

```

Not sure this is the issue, maybe yes... hoping there is an expert among you.

I also would like to add the normal map rendering, but one thing at a time, unless you can submit it if you want, with pleasure !

Thanks !
